content: This article **needs additional citations for verification**. Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "Telok Ayer Constituency" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(January 2022)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* **Telok Ayer Constituency** was a [constituency](/wiki/Constituencies_of_Singapore) in Singapore. It existed from 1951 to 1988, where it was absorbed into [Kreta Ayer SMC](/wiki/Kreta_Ayer_SMC). ## History In 1988, the constituency was dissolved following the establishment of [Group representation constituency](/wiki/Group_representation_constituency) (GRC) and [Single Member Constituency](/wiki/Single_Member_Constituency) (SMC). ## Member of Parliament **Election** **Member****Party****Formation**[Legislative Assembly of Singapore](/wiki/Legislative_Assembly_of_Singapore)**1955**[Rajabali Jumabhoy](/wiki/Rajabali_Jumabhoy)[INDP](/wiki/Independent_politician)**1959**[Ong Pang Boon](/wiki/Ong_Pang_Boon)[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)**1963**[Parliament of Singapore](/wiki/Parliament_of_Singapore)**1968**[Ong Pang Boon](/wiki/Ong_Pang_Boon)[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)**1972****1976****1980****1984****Constituency abolished (1988)** ## Electoral results Note: The [Elections Department](/wiki/Elections_Department_Singapore) does not include rejected votes when calculating the vote shares of candidates. Hence, all candidates' vote shares will total to 100% at any given election (may not appear so in multi-way contests due to rounding). ### Elections in 1950s [Legislative Assembly General Election
